title: Metacognitive Strategies for Enhancing Problem-Solving Skills in Chemistry

context.prior_knowledge: Middle School Chemistry Foundational Concepts (Atomic Structure, Chemical Equations, Mole Calculations, etc.)
context.additional_context: A program for secondary education practitioners to systematically train metacognitive strategies in chemistry problem-solving, offering personalized feedback to address individual learning gaps.

learning_goals: Learners can explicitly explain the problem identification, goal setting, and strategy planning stages when solving chemistry problems.
Learners can utilize at least three checklists for real-time self-monitoring during problem-solving processes.
Learners can apply reflective self-assessment techniques by creating personal metacognitive journals to evaluate problem-solving outcomes.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
